title: Definitions
context: [§321-502] Definitions. As used in this part: &ldquo;Adult&rdquo; means a person eighteen years of age or older. &ldquo;Adult death review information&rdquo; means information regarding the adult person and person&rsquo;s family, including: (1) Social, medical, and legal histories; (2) Death and birth certificates; (3) Law enforcement investigative data; (4) Medical examiner or coroner investigative data; (5) Parole and probation information and records; (6) Information and records of social service agencies; (7) Educational records; and (8) Health care institution information. &ldquo;Department&rdquo; means the department of health. &ldquo;Developmental disability&rdquo; means a severe, chronic disability of a person that: (1) Is attributable to a mental or physical impairment or combination of mental and physical impairments; (2) Is manifested before the person attains age twenty-two; (3) Is likely to continue indefinitely; (4) Results in substantial functional limitations in three or more of the following areas of major life activity: (i) Self-care; (ii) Receptive and expressive language; (iii) Learning; (iv) Mobility; (v) Self-direction; (vi) Capacity for independent living; and (vii) Economic self-sufficiency; and (5) Reflects the person&rsquo;s need for a combination and sequence of special, interdisciplinary, or generic care, treatment, or other services that are of lifelong or extended duration and are individually planned and coordinated. &ldquo;Director&rdquo; means the director of health or the directors designated representative. &ldquo;Intellectual disability&rdquo; means significantly subaverage general intellectual functioning resulting in or associated with concurrent moderate, severe, or profound impairments in adaptive behavior and manifested during the developmental period. &ldquo;Person with developmental or intellectual disabilities&rdquo; means an adult with a developmental or intellectual disability. &ldquo;Preventable death&rdquo; means a death that reasonable medical, social, legal, psychological, or educational intervention may have prevented. &ldquo;Provider of medical care&rdquo; means any health care practitioner who provides, or a facility through which is provided, any medical evaluation or treatment, including dental and mental health evaluation or treatment. [L 2012, c 162, pt of §1]
